column4: OK, from the simple question about 50 euros, there's a war breaking out over monitor standards :O
So, lets change the subject... what applications would you recommend from the Ubuntu Edgy Add/Remove applications for someone of a developer/hacker/networking turn of mind?
I'm asking for points of view - there's a multitude of different apps for the same thing!
achieve? Well I'm a programmer/hacker/developer moving totally over from Windows so I'm used to having all sorts of tools around 'just in case' for hacking badly behaved apps, networks, etc.
I use Eclipse for development, Wireshark for net hacking, etc
I've got eclipse, thats not a problem. I was looking through the list of apps in Edgy's Add/Remove and wondering what else to add
there's a lot of KDE stuff in there, which I presumably can't use in Gnome?
I'm just interested and what other people find to be useful tools
strace is a great tool also for debugging purpose
thanks - I'll google that now to find about it
YES, thats the kind of thing I like to have about me!
that's the bigger troll in the community, I prefer emacs
lots of people only swear by the name of vim also
writing in hexadecimal???? Why the hell would one do that?
